intro: Chamaesyce adenoptera subsp. pergamena, commonly known as the parchment weed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in dry conditions. The species is known for its ability to tolerate extreme temperatures and is often found in disturbed or sandy habitats.
